channel.title: Make this code countdown instead of up?
channel.description:
Hi,
How do I make this website script countdown from 7 seconds, instead of up:
[code] <script> <!-- /*By George Chiang. (JK's ultimate JavaScript tutorial and free JavaScripts site!) http://www.javascriptkit.com Credit MUST stay intact for use*/ var milisec=0 var seconds=0 document.d.d2.value='0' function display(){ if (milisec>=9){ milisec=0 seconds+=1 } else milisec+=1 document.d.d2.value=seconds+"."+milisec setTimeout("display()",100) } display() //--> </script>[/code]
Because I need it to tell website visitors when they are going to get redirected.
Thanks
Musicmad

item.title: Make this code countdown instead of up?
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

I’d say change anything that would count up AKA (PLUS (+)) to( MINUS (-)) making it do the oppsite logicialllllllll duhhh

Read full topic

item.title: Make this code countdown instead of up?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

[quote=“cumescape, post:3, topic:199367”]I was going to suggest this but it doesn’t show the time left

<meta http-equiv="Refresh" content="5; url=/Forum/">[/quote]He could use it, just put something on the page like “You are being redirected to somewhere in 5 seconds.” There’s no actual need for a timer.

Read full topic
